author: Simon Rice
title: Man Utd and Leeds legend Alan Smith on verge of taking Notts County caretaker role
text:
Alan Smith pictured during the start of the season (Getty) Former Manchester United and Leeds striker Alan Smith is set to take his first major step into management by taking a caretaker role at Notts County.
The League Two side are on the hunt for their 11 th manager in six-and-a-half-years following the dismissal of John Sheridan yesterday.
Julian Draxler reveals why he snubbed Arsenal to join Paris Saint-Germain It’s understood to only be a short-term plan with new owner Alan Hardy hunting for a coach with extensive lower league experience. The club are in dire need of a change in fortunes having lost nine successive games which has them sitting one point above the relegation zone.
Smith has been with Notts County since 2014 after joining in a player-coach capacity. In over 50 appearances he is yet to score for the club.
Alan Smith during his time at United (Getty) Smith started his career with Leeds (Getty) More: Football Chelsea and Spurs combined XI, with Costa over Kane in one-sided line up

The 36-year-old made his name at Leeds United where he graduated from the academy. In 2004 he joined Manchester United but his three seasons at Old Trafford were hampered by injury. However he did manager to score some memorable goals, notably in a 7-1 Champions League win over Roma.
